enum.name: ConnectionMode
enum.comment: Describe how to connect nodes to the graph.
enum.item:
The node is will not be initially connected.
The difference to UNCONNECTED is that we do not connect the nodes just now, but will do so later, e.g. by adding edges. Note that it is an error not to connect the node later.

The node is marked as unconnected and will not be connected to another node. This kind of nodes is useful to mark points and possibly assign properties without needing to travel to it.
The difference to NOT_CONNECTED is that the nodes will be explicitly marked as not being connected and it is an error to connect them.
Connect point to the node on the graph closest to the given point.

Connect point to the edge in which segment it lies, i.e. search for an edge where we can find a perpendicular line going through the given point and any point on the edge's line segment. If no such segment is found, the point cannot be added.
First try the CLOSEST_EDGE method. If that yields no result, use the CLOSEST_NODE method as a fallback.

enum.name: FilterType
enum.item:
If enabled, filters out all edges after the map generation that pass too close by an occupied cell of the map. Use this to get rid of connections which "pass through walls". Note that this step is done before adding points of interest. Therefore edges going to POIs might still pass through or close by occupied cells.
Parameters: distance: minimum distance from edges to occupied map grid cells to consider it safe.
If enabled, filters out all nodes which are not connected to any other node. These can occur, for example, after performing the FILTER_EDGES_BY_MAP filter.

Sometimes after applying other filters one can end up with multiple disconnected graphs. Enabling this filter will keep only the largest connected graph and simply remove all nodes and edges from smaller graphs not connected to the largest.

enum.name: EdgeMode
enum.comment: When adding edges, the mode defines how to add edges.
enum.item: Only insert edge if it does not intersect with any other existing edge in the graph.
If the new edge intersects with one or more edges, add new points at the intersections and split the edges for this point.
The edge is added as-is, it may overlap or intersect with other edges.

enum.name: Algorithm
enum.item: Voronoi-based algorithm for navgraph generation. This is the default if no algorithm is set.

Grid-based algorithm with customizable spacing.
Parameters: - spacing: the grid spacing in meters (float, m, mandatory) - margin: the minimum distances of edges to obstacles (float, m, mandatory) - add-diagonals: enable adding of diagonal edges in grid cells (bool, optional, default: false)

data.comment:
This interfaces is used to instruct the navgraph-generator. It allows to add obstacles and points of interest and perform a computation run of the graph generation.
Operations to modify the parameters (clearing, adding/removing obstacles or points of interest etc.) take effect only once a ComputeMessage is sent. This can be used, for example, to first clear the graph, update it with the latest information, and finally generate the graph.
As soon as any instruction has been received, the generato shall only listen to messages from the same sender. Only after a computation has been performed can another node send messages again.
data.field: The ID of the message that is currently being processed or was processed last.
True, if the last generation triggered by a ComputeMessage has been completed, false if it is still running. Also check the msgid field if this field applies to the correct message.
Indicate success (true) or failure (false) of the most recent navgraph generation (valid if final equals true).
If the "ok" field is false, may give an additional clue about the encountered error.

message.name: Clear
message.comment: Remove all currently know obstacles. Use this operation with care. A graph generation afterwards will yield now results.

message.name: SetAlgorithm
message.comment: Set algorithm used to generate graph.
message.field: Algorithm to use.

message.name: SetAlgorithmParameter
message.field: Parameter name, see Algorithm enum description for algorithm-specific parameters. Unknown parameters will be ignored.
Value of parameter encoded as string. The algorithm will perform the conversion to the required data type (e.g., float). An error will make the generation fail.

message.name: SetBoundingBox
message.comment: Set the bounding box to use for graph generation. No edge that leads outside this bounding box is considered for the graph.
message.field: X coordinate of bbox start point in global frame.
Y coordinate of bbox start point in global frame.
X coordinate of bbox end point in global frame.
Y coordinate of bbox end point in global frame.

message.name: SetFilter
message.comment: Enable or disable a post-processing filter.
message.field: Which filter to enable/disable.
True to enable, false to disable

message.name: SetFilterParamFloat
message.comment: Enable or disable a post-processing filter.
message.field: Which filter to enable/disable.
Parameter name, see FilterType description for possible values.
True to enable, false to disable

message.name: AddMapObstacles
message.comment: Calculate useful obstacle points from the currently configured map.
message.field: For points generated on lines found in the map, do not exceed this threshold in terms of maximum distance of points on line.

message.name: AddObstacle
message.comment: Add an obstacle to be avoided by the graph. The obstacle is given as a centroid in X-Y ground-support plane of global frame, typical /map frame.
message.field: ID of the obstacle. Can later be used to remove it again.
X coordinate of obstacle in global frame.
Y coordinate of obstacle in global frame.

message.name: RemoveObstacle
message.field: ID of the obstacle to remove.

message.name: AddPointOfInterest
message.comment: Add a point which shall be reachable as a target. The POI is given as a centroid in X-Y ground-support plane of global frame, typical /map frame.
message.field: ID of the obstacle. Can later be used to remove it again.
X coordinate of obstacle in global frame.
Y coordinate of obstacle in global frame.
The connection mode to use to connect the POI with the graph.

message.name: AddPointOfInterestWithOri
message.comment: Add a point which shall be reachable as a target. The POI is given as a centroid in X-Y ground-support plane of global frame, typical /map frame. This form also accepts a desired target orientation for the point.
message.field: ID of the obstacle. Can later be used to remove it again.
X coordinate of obstacle in global frame.
Y coordinate of obstacle in global frame.
Orientation for target point (rad).
The connection mode to use to connect the POI with the graph.

message.name: SetPointOfInterestProperty
message.comment: Set a property for an already added point of interest.
message.field: ID of the point of interest.
Name of the property to set.
Value of the property to set.

message.name: AddEdge
message.comment: Add an edge between two points. Edges for which one of the end points does not exist are silently ignored. The points are given in the X-Y ground-support plane of global frame, typical /map frame.
message.field: ID of first node.
ID of second node.
True to create a directed edge from p1 to p2, otherwise the edge is assumed to be undirected.
The edge insertion mode.

message.name: SetGraphDefaultProperty
message.comment: Set a graph default property property.
message.field: Name of the property to set.
Value of the property to set.

message.name: SetCopyGraphDefaultProperties
message.comment: Set if the graph default properties should be copied from the previous graph. This defaults to enabled and is reset on Clear.
message.field: True to enable copying (default) false to disable).

message.name: RemovePointOfInterest
message.comment: Remove a specific point of interest.
message.field: ID of the obstacle to remove.

message.name: Compute
message.comment: Compute the graph with the currently available information.
